intro: Pachycarpus concolor subsp. rhinophyllus, commonly known as the rhinophyllus pachycarpus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody structure and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, helping to store water, while its flowers are often pink or purple in color. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
